intro: Tithymalus × wimmerianus, commonly known as the hybrid tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial to full shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
